shared_text:
MVCSC Health Services
August 7 at 8:12 PM ·

We are so excited to see our students on August 17th!
We have missed seeing all their smiling faces and helping them with their needs.

We are working diligently to capture all immunizations that may have been administered over the summer. Thank you to all the families that have submitted updated shot records thus far. Please be sure to submit any updated shot records to your schools health room assistants. We will be sending out additional reminders next week.

Along with COVID-19 concerns, state and local representatives continue to express the need for staying current with required immunizations. Our exclusion date for missing immunizations (required for school enrollment) will be September 14th.

Contact your schools health room assistant or the Corporation nurse with any questions.

shared_text:
Mt Vernon Education Foundation
April 13 at 7:20 PM ·

In response to our stakeholders who would like to support our MV community during this unique season, the Mt. Vernon Education Foundation has created a Response and Impact Fund.

The foundation has identified the following categories of need and support;
1. Teacher and Student e-learning support
2. Support for our MV families
3. Community Support for Frontline Responders, Food Support, and Local Businesses

We know many of you will donate just by knowing the current critical needs- we thank you! Since the passing last week of the CARES Act there are some additional advantages to giving that you might find advantageous.

1.A new "above the line" charitable deduction of up to $300

2.For 2020, the income limit for cash contributions to charity rises to 100% of AGI(from the current 60$ AGI limit)

3.The repeal of the required minimum distributions (RMD) for 2020

Online donations can be made by going to www.MtVernonFoundation.org

If you would prefer to contribute by check our mailing address is 1806 W St. Rd 234, Fortville, Indiana 46040

post_text: Fortville Community Members: Please check out the new Relay app which enables communication with the Fortville Police Department. The "Relay Safety" (free) app allows you to report non-emergency incidents directly to law enforcement and receive real-time alerts from officers. Give it a try!
shared_text:
Fortville Police Department
February 12 at 3:11 PM ·

With the upcoming weather forecast for today have you ever wished you could find out about traffic accidents or road closures before you got stuck in the traffic? You now can with the latest release of Relay. Officers can push out broadcast about traffic alerts, severe weather or active threat situations in our community. If your address is near these locations, you will receive push notifications from the app but also see these broadcasts on the map.

To take advantage of this new functionality, ensure you have your home address added to your profile and your notifications are turned on with the app.

Additionally, we are expecting officers to be busy with the road conditions this evening. If you do slide off of the road or have a non-emergent accident where no one is injured, you can use the RELAY app or call the non-emergency dispatch number (317-477-4400) to report this.

Don’t have Relay yet? Search Relay Neighborhood in your App Store or visit relayapp.com.

Please drive carefully this evening and tomorrow morning. We want everyone to be safe and get where they want to go!!
